definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the brain or the spinal cord.

mondo_label: adrenal cortical carcinoma by ensat stage
original_label: Adrenal Cortical Carcinoma by ENSAT Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of adrenal cortical carcinoma according to the European Network for the Study of Adrenal Tumors (ENSAT).
A rapidly growing serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of high grade cytologic features and frequent mitotic figures.

A slow-growing serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the ovary.  It usually originates from borderline neoplastic processes or adenofibromas.  It is characterized by the presence of low grade cytologic features and infrequent mitotic figures.

mondo_label: uveal melanoma by gene expression profile
original_label: Uveal Melanoma by Gene Expression Profile

definition: Classification of glioblastoma into molecular subtypes as defined by gene expression profiling.
A staging system for thymoma based on the anatomic extent of disease at the time of surgery.
A carcinosarcoma of the uterus characterized by the presence of sarcomatous elements that arise from the tissues of the uterus.
A carcinosarcoma of the uterus characterized by the presence of sarcomatous elements composed of tissues that are not found in the uterus (e.g., bone, cartilage, skeletal muscle).

mondo_label: main duct pancreatic intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm
original_label: Main Duct Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm
definition: An intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm of the pancreas that arises from the main pancreatic duct.

mondo_label: branch duct pancreatic intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm
original_label: Branch Duct Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm
definition: An intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm of the pancreas that arises in one of the branches of the main pancreatic duct.  It usually has an indolent behavior.

mondo_label: mixed type pancreatic intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm
original_label: Mixed Type Pancreatic Intraductal Papillary-Mucinous Neoplasm
definition: An intraductal papillary-mucinous neoplasm of the pancreas that arises primarily from the main pancreatic duct and extends to the branch ducts.

mondo_label: adult undifferentiated high grade pleomorphic sarcoma of bone
original_label: Adult Undifferentiated High Grade Pleomorphic Sarcoma of Bone
definition: An undifferentiated high grade pleomorphic sarcoma that arises from the bone and occurs during adulthood.

mondo_label: metastatic malignant neoplasm in the soft tissues
original_label: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Soft Tissues
definition: A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the soft tissues from another anatomic site.
An epithelioid hemangioendothelioma that occurs during adulthood.
A Hodgkin lymphoma that arises from the central nervous system.
Fibrolamellar variant of hepatocellular carcinoma that occurs during adulthood.

A staging classification system for hepatocellular carcinoma that uses variables related to tumor stage, liver functional status, physical status, and cancer-related symptoms, and links the stages with a treatment algorithm. (HPB (Oxford) 2005; 7(1):35-41)
Myelodysplastic syndrome that occurs in adulthood.
A carcinoma that arises from the distal part of the urethra.
Germ cell tumor that arises from the testis and is diagnosed in at least two relatives.
A carcinoma that arises from the proximal part of the urethra.

mondo_label: invasive bladder urothelial carcinoma associated with urethral carcinoma
original_label: Invasive Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma Associated with Urethral Carcinoma
definition: Invasive urothelial carcinoma of the bladder which is associated with the presence of in situ or infiltrating urethral carcinoma.
A congenital lymphatic malformation usually arising from the neck and characterized by cystic dilation of the lymphatic vessels.
A plasmacytoma characterized by the presence of malignant plasma cells with anaplastic features.
A carcinoma of the penis that occurs during adulthood.
A carcinoma of the salivary gland that occurs during adulthood.
A melanoma that arises from the structures of the orbit.
A malignant neoplasm that affects the renal parenchyma but not the pelvis.

A benign mesenchymal neoplasm characterized by the presence of spindle shaped myofibroblasts and mast cells in a collagenous stroma.  It is histologically identical to the myofibroblastoma of breast.  It usually arises from the subcutaneous tissue and the most common sites of involvement are the inguinal/groin, paratesticular, and vulvovaginal areas.
A rare leiomyosarcoma that arises from the deep soft tissue in the retroperitoneum or abdominal cavity.
An uncommon variant of rhabdomyosarcoma with spindle cell or sclerosing morphology.  It affects both children and adults and it is more common in males.
An angiosarcoma that arises from the soft tissues, usually in the deep muscles of the lower extremities, retroperitoneum, mediastinum, and mesentery.
A common, usually encapsulated benign nerve sheath tumor composed of well-differentiated Schwann cells.

A benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor characterized by the presence of Schwann cells, axons, and perineurial fibroblasts.  It usually arises from the skin of the head and neck or the oral mucosa.  It presents as a solitary and painless nodular mass.
A benign nerve sheath tumor characterized by the combination of histologic features seen in schwannomas, neurofibromas, and perineuriomas.

mondo_label: malignant mixed tumor, not otherwise specified
original_label: Malignant Mixed Tumor, Not Otherwise Specified
definition: A malignant myoepithelioma characterized by the presence of a minor ductal component.
A phosphaturic mesenchymal tumor with benign histologic features.  It may recur locally but does not metastasize.  Complete excision is curative.

A phosphaturic mesenchymal tumor characterized by the presence of nuclear atypia, high mitotic activity, increased cellularity, marked pleomorphism, and necrosis. It usually develops in lesions that have recurred locally and metastasizes to other sites.
A tumor with perivascular epithelioid cell differentiation characterized by the presence of cords of neoplastic cells in a densely collagenous stroma.

A term that refers to a heterogeneous group of uncommon soft tissue sarcomas that do not show an identifiable line of differentiation using currently available technologies.  This is a diagnosis of exclusion and includes undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma (also known as malignant fibrous histiocytoma), undifferentiated spindle cell sarcoma, undifferentiated round cell sarcoma, and undifferentiated epithelioid sarcoma.

A rare benign chondroid and osteoid matrix-producing neoplasm of bone characterized by extensive myxoid changes.  It may be a locally destructive neoplasm and has been reported in patients with Carney complex.

A benign tumor that affects the distal phalanx, most often the great toe. Grossly it consists of a cartilage cap and a bony stalk. Microscopically it is characterized by an osteochondromatous proliferation with a gradual transition of a peripheral spindle-cell proliferation to hyaline cartilage to trabecular bone. Pain and swelling are present. Simple resection is usually curative.

A benign lesion that usually affects the proximal small bones of the hands or feet.  Grossly it consists of a cartilage cap and a bony stalk.  Microscopically it is characterized by the presence of spindle cells, cartilage, and bone, usually in a disorganized pattern compared to subungual exostosis.  Enlarged (bizarre) chondrocytes are present in the cartilage.  Swelling with or without pain is present.  Recurrences following resection have been reported in approximately half of cases.
A locally aggressive or rarely metastasizing cartilaginous matrix-producing neoplasm characterized by the presence of neoplastic chondrocytes.

An intermediate-grade chondrosarcoma arising in the medulla of bone or within the cartilaginous cap of a pre-existing osteochondroma. It is characterized by the presence of increased cellularity and a greater degree of nuclear atypia and hyperchromasia as compared to grade 1 chondrosarcoma. Mitotic activity is present.

A high-grade chondrosarcoma arising in the medulla of bone or within the cartilaginous cap of a pre-existing osteochondroma. It is characterized by the presence of increased cellularity and a greater degree of nuclear atypia, hyperchromasia, and mitotic activity as compared to grade 2 chondrosarcoma.

An intraosseous benign tumor of notochord origin that arises in the bones of the base of the skull, vertebral bodies, sacrum or coccyx.  It contains vacuolated tumor cells without atypia, but lacks myxoid matrix, necrosis, and lobular architecture, which are features that characterize its malignant counterpart, chordoma.  Most lesions are incidental findings.
A non-metastasizing, locally aggressive, bone-forming neoplasm.
A locally aggressive or rarely metastasizing neoplasm that arises from the bone.

A non-Hodgkin lymphoma that arises from the bone, without lymph node or other extranodal involvement.  The femur, spine, and pelvic bones are the most frequently affected areas.  The majority of cases are diffuse large B-cell lymphomas.  Most patients present with pain in the affected area.  Systemic symptoms are rare.

A low-grade malignant blood vessel neoplasm arising from the bone.  It is characterized by the presence of epithelioid endothelial cells.  The neoplastic cells are arranged in cords and nests, which are embedded in a myxoid to hyalinized stroma.

mondo_label: acute lymphoblastic leukemia by gene expression profile
original_label: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia by Gene Expression Profile
definition: Gene expression-based patient cluster groups in acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

mondo_label: borderline ovarian serous tumor/atypical proliferative ovarian serous tumor
original_label: Borderline Ovarian Serous Tumor/Atypical Proliferative Ovarian Serous Tumor
definition: A non-invasive serous neoplasm that arises from the ovary and shows greater cellular proliferation and cytologic atypia as compared to benign ovarian serous tumors, but less as compared to low-grade ovarian serous carcinoma.

mondo_label: borderline ovarian serous tumor-micropapillary variant/non-invasive low grade ovarian serous carcinoma
original_label: Borderline Ovarian Serous Tumor-Micropapillary Variant/Non-Invasive Low Grade Ovarian Serous Carcinoma
definition: A non-invasive serous neoplasm that arises from the ovary and shows micropapillary and/or cribriform architectural patterns.  It is composed of round epithelial cells with scant cytoplasm and moderate nuclear atypia.
An acute lymphoblastic or acute myeloid leukemia that occurs in infancy.

mondo_label: childhood acute myeloid leukemia not otherwise specified
original_label: Childhood Acute Myeloid Leukemia Not Otherwise Specified
definition: Acute myeloid leukemias that occur in childhood and do not fulfill the criteria for inclusion in the group of acute myeloid leukemias which have recurrent genetic abnormalities or myelodysplastic changes, or are therapy-related.  This category includes entities classified according to the French-American-British classification scheme.
Myelodysplastic syndrome characterized by decreased cellularity in the bone marrow.
Acute myeloid leukemia not associated with cytogenetic abnormalities.

mondo_label: childhood acute myeloid leukemia with abnormalities of chromosome 5q
original_label: Childhood Acute Myeloid Leukemia with Abnormalities of Chromosome 5q
definition: A rare acute myeloid leukemia that occurs in childhood and is characterized primarily by deletions of 5q.

mondo_label: childhood acute myeloid leukemia with abnormalities of chromosome 7
original_label: Childhood Acute Myeloid Leukemia with Abnormalities of Chromosome 7
definition: A rare acute myeloid leukemia that occurs in childhood and is characterized by deletion of chromosome 7.
Lymphomatoid granulomatosis that occurs during childhood.

mondo_label: childhood langerhans cell histiocytosis with risk organ involvement
original_label: Childhood Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis with Risk Organ Involvement
definition: Langerhans cell histiocytosis that occurs during childhood and involves the bone marrow, spleen, liver, or lung.

mondo_label: childhood langerhans cell histiocytosis without risk organ involvement
original_label: Childhood Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis without Risk Organ Involvement
definition: Langerhans cell histiocytosis that occurs during childhood and does not involve the bone marrow, spleen, liver, or lung.

A rhabdomyosarcoma characterized by the presence of chromosomal translocation t(1;13)(p36;q14) that results in PAX7-FOXO1 gene fusion; or translocation t(2;13)(q35;q14) that results in PAX3-FOXO1 gene fusion.
A rhabdomyosarcoma characterized by the absence of chromosomal translocation t(1;13)(p36;q14) or t(2;13)(q35;q14) and therefore the absence of PAX7-FOXO1 or PAX3-FOXO1 gene fusion.
Malignant germ cell tumor resistant to treatment.
A germinomatous germ cell tumor occurring in children.
A nongerminomatous germ cell tumor occurring in children.
A mixed germ cell tumor occurring in children.
An astrocytoma that occurs during childhood.
An atypical choroid plexus papilloma that occurs during childhood.
A rare benign mesothelial tumor that arises from the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of gland-like structures.
Chronic eosinophilic leukemia characterized by the rearrangement of the PDGFRA gene, most often resulting in the formation of FIP1L1-PDGFRA fusion transcripts.

mondo_label: primary peritoneal high grade serous adenocarcinoma
original_label: Primary Peritoneal High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma
definition: A serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the lining of the peritoneum. It is characterized by high grade histopathologic features.

mondo_label: primary peritoneal low grade serous adenocarcinoma
original_label: Primary Peritoneal Low Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma
definition: A serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the lining of the peritoneum. It is characterized by low grade histopathologic features.

mondo_label: peritoneal desmoplastic small round cell tumor
original_label: Peritoneal Desmoplastic Small Round Cell Tumor
definition: A desmoplastic small round cell tumor that occurs in the abdominal and/or pelvic peritoneum.

Fibromatosis that occurs in the pelvis. It affects almost always females. It is characterized by the presence of elongated spindle-shaped fibroblasts, collagenous stroma formation, and an infiltrative growth pattern. It recurs if incompletely resected but lacks metastatic potential.
Inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor that arises from the abdominal cavity.

A thyroid gland carcinoma characterized by the presence of cribriform, trabecular, follicular, papillary, and solid growth patterns and squamoid morulae formation. It may occur with familial adenomatous polyposis or sporadically.

mondo_label: thyroid gland papillary carcinoma with fibromatosis/fasciitis-like/desmoid-type stroma
original_label: Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma with Fibromatosis/Fasciitis-Like/Desmoid-Type Stroma
definition: A rare morphologic variant of papillary thyroid gland carcinoma characterized by the presence of abundant and cellular stroma resembling nodular fasciitis, fibromatosis, or other proliferative myofibroblastic processes. (WHO)

mondo_label: fallopian tube high grade serous adenocarcinoma
original_label: Fallopian Tube High Grade Serous Adenocarcinoma
definition: A rapidly growing serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the fallopian tube. It is characterized by the presence of high grade cytologic features and frequent mitotic figures.
An exceedingly rare lymphoma that arises from the fallopian tube.
A rare serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the broad ligament.
A high-grade carcinoma that arises from the oropharynx. It is characterized by the presence of malignant cells which bear minimal resemblance to the cells from which they arose.

A carcinoma that arises from the endometrium and is characterized by the presence of an undifferentiated carcinomatous component and a second component of either FIGO grade 1 or 2 endometrioid carcinoma.
A variant of leiomyoma arising from the uterine corpus. It is characterized by conspicuous zonal edema. Hyalinization may also be present.

mondo_label: uterine corpus high grade endometrial stromal sarcoma
original_label: Uterine Corpus High Grade Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma
definition: A rare, high grade sarcoma that arises from the endometrial stroma. It is characterized by round cell morphology. It was previously also known as undifferentiated uterine sarcoma. In 2014, high grade endometrial stromal sarcoma was reclassified and is currently considered a distinct and rare neoplasm. It appears to have a prognosis that falls between low grade endometrial stromal sarcoma and undifferentiated sarcoma.

A benign neoplasm with perivascular epithelioid cell differentiation arising from the uterine corpus. It is characterized by the absence of pleomorphism and scarcity or absence of mitotic figures. It usually affects perimenopausal women. Patients present with a pelvic mass or abnormal bleeding.
A benign or malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the uterine corpus. Representative examples include teratoma and yolk sac tumor.

A neuroendocrine neoplasm that arises from the cervix. This category includes neuroendocrine tumor grade 1, neuroendocrine tumor grade 2, and neuroendocrine carcinoma (small cell and large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma).
A rare squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the vagina resembling transitional cell carcinoma of the urinary tract.

A category of staging terms for ovarian cancer according to the International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO), 2014. AJCC ovarian cancer stage terms from the 6th and 7th editions that are synonymous to the FIGO ovarian cancer staging classification of 2014 are included as preferred terms.

mondo_label: ovarian cancer by ajcc v6 and v7 stage
original_label: Ovarian Cancer by AJCC v6 and v7 Stage
definition: A category of staging terms for ovarian cancer according to the American Joint Committee on cancer (AJCC) 6th and 7th editions. International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) ovarian cancer staging terms prior to 2014 are included in this category if synonymous with the AJCC terms.
A germ tumor that arises from the vagina.

An intraepithelial lesion of the vulvar squamous epithelium associated with HPV infection. It is characterized by maturation abnormalities and nuclear hyperchromasia that are confined to the basement membrane.

mondo_label: vulvar adenocarcinoma of mammary gland type
original_label: Vulvar Adenocarcinoma of Mammary Gland Type
definition: A primary invasive malignant epithelial neoplasm of the vulva showing morphological features of recognized breast adenocarcinomas. (WHO, 2014)
A rare vulvar mucinous adenocarcinoma that resembles a large intestinal adenocarcinoma.

A keratoacanthoma that arises from the vulva. It grows rapidly and may regress spontaneously. It is considered a variant of well-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma with distinct clinical behavior.
A rare germ cell tumor that arises from the vulva.

mondo_label: b acute lymphoblastic leukemia, philadelphia chromosome negative
original_label: B Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia, Philadelphia Chromosome Negative
definition: A B-acute lymphoblastic leukemia (B-ALL) that does not have the cytogenetic abnormality t(9;22)(q34;q11.2). Most cases of B-ALL do not have this translocation.
A very rare NK-cell lymphoma with pathologic and clinical features posing difficulty in its exact diagnosis and classification.

An autosomal dominant genetic disorder caused by mutations in the CDKN2A gene, encoding cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 2A. The condition is characterized by cutaneous malignant melanoma associated with this genetic alteration.
A central nervous system tumor with morphological features of glioblastoma in which there is insufficient information on the IDH genes status.
An oligodendroglioma carrying IDH gene family mutation and combined whole-arm losses of 1p and 19q (1p/19q codeletion).
A central nervous system tumor with morphological features of oligodendroglioma in which there is insufficient information on the IDH genes and 1p/19q codeletion status.
An anaplastic oligodendroglioma carrying IDH gene family mutation and combined whole-arm losses of 1p and 19q (1p/19q codeletion).
A central nervous system tumor with morphological features of anaplastic oligodendroglioma in which there is insufficient information on the IDH genes and 1p/19q codeletion status.
A central nervous system tumor with morphological features of oligoastrocytoma in which there is insufficient information on the IDH genes status.
A central nervous system tumor with morphological features of anaplastic oligoastrocytoma in which there is insufficient information on the IDH genes status.
A glioma that has diffusely infiltrated the surrounding central nervous system tissues.

A WHO grade 3 pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma characterized by the presence of five or more mitoses per 10 high-power fields. Necrosis may be present. Patients have shorter survival rates when compared to those with WHO grade 2 pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma.

A relatively slow growing diffuse leptomeningeal neoplasm usually affecting children and adolescents. It is characterized by the presence of clear glial neoplastic cells reminiscent of oligodendroglioma. A neuronal component may be present. The prognosis is variable.
A low-grade tumor affecting the cerebral hemispheres. It is composed of cells with glial and/or neuronal differentiation forming multiple nodules with prominent vacuolation.
A term that refers to the classification of medulloblastomas according to their molecular characteristics.
A medulloblastoma which has not been further characterized.
An adenocarcinoma composed of small malignant cells.

mondo_label: central nervous system solitary fibrous tumor
original_label: Central Nervous System Solitary Fibrous Tumor
definition: A mesenchymal, non-meningothelial neoplasm arising from the central nervous system. It is characterized by a collagenous and low cellularity spindle cell and/or hemangiopericytomatous histopathological pattern, recurrent intrachromosomal rearrangement on chromosome 12q that results in the fusion of the NAB2 and STAT6 genes, high recurrence rates, and long-term risk of systemic metastasis.
A mesenchymal chondrosarcoma that arises from the central nervous system.
A low-grade malignant blood vessel neoplasm that arises from the central nervous system.  It is characterized by the presence of epithelioid endothelial cells.
An angiolipoma that arises from the central nervous system.

mondo_label: central nervous system undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma
original_label: Central Nervous System Undifferentiated Pleomorphic Sarcoma
definition: A rare undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma (formerly known as malignant fibrous histiocytoma) involving the central nervous system.

mondo_label: central nervous system anaplastic large cell lymphoma, alk-positive
original_label: Central Nervous System Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma, ALK-Positive
definition: An anaplastic large cell lymphoma, ALK-positive, arising from the central nervous system.

mondo_label: central nervous system anaplastic large cell lymphoma, alk-negative
original_label: Central Nervous System Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma, ALK-Negative
definition: An anaplastic large cell lymphoma, ALK-negative, arising from the central nervous system.

mondo_label: central nervous system intravascular large b-cell lymphoma
original_label: Central Nervous System Intravascular Large B-Cell Lymphoma
definition: A rare extranodal B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma that affects the central nervous system.  It is characterized by the presence of lymphoma cells exclusively in the lumina of small vessels, particularly capillaries.

mondo_label: acute myeloid leukemia with biallelic cebpa mutation
original_label: Acute Myeloid Leukemia with Biallelic CEBPA Mutation
definition: An acute myeloid leukemia with double mutations of the CEBPA gene.

mondo_label: acute myeloid leukemia with monoallelic cebpa mutation
original_label: Acute Myeloid Leukemia with Monoallelic CEBPA Mutation
definition: An acute myeloid leukemia with single mutations of the CEBPA gene.

B lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma characterized by a gene-expression profile similar to that of BCR-ABL1-positive B lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma, absence of the pathognomonic BCR-ABL1 rearrangement, alterations of lymphoid transcription factor genes, and a poor outcome.
A carcinoma that arises from transitional cells and has spread from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

mondo_label: chronic myelomonocytic leukemia with eosinophilia associated with t(5;12)(q31;p12)
original_label: Chronic Myelomonocytic Leukemia with Eosinophilia Associated with t(5;12)(q31;p12)
definition: Chronic myelomonocytic leukemia characterized by the presence of eosinophilia, PDGFRB gene rearrangement, and t(5;12)(q31;p12).
A chronic myelomonocytic leukemia characterized by the presence of less than 5 percent blasts in the bone marrow and less than 2 percent blasts in the peripheral blood.

mondo_label: myelodysplastic syndrome with ring sideroblasts and single lineage dysplasia
original_label: Myelodysplastic Syndrome with Ring Sideroblasts and Single Lineage Dysplasia
definition: A myelodysplastic syndrome with ring sideroblasts and dysplastic changes involving only one myeloid cell lineage in the bone marrow.

mondo_label: b lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma with intrachromosomal amplification of chromosome 21
original_label: B Lymphoblastic Leukemia/Lymphoma with Intrachromosomal Amplification of Chromosome 21
definition: B lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma characterized by amplification of a portion of chromosome 21. It usually occurs in children and is associated with an adverse prognosis.

An unusual variant of capillary hemangioma. It is characterized by a unique anastomosing sinusoidal-like architecture which may mimic angiosarcoma. It was originally described in the kidney but rare cases have been reported in other sites.
A non-Down syndrome acute megakaryoblastic leukemia that occurs in childhood. It is associated with CBFA2T3-GLIS2 chimeric oncogene and has an unfavorable prognosis.
An extramedullary myeloid tumor that arises from the small intestine. It often presents with abdominal pain and obstruction.
A usually aggressive and invasive pituitary neuroendocrine tumor characterized by excessive p53 immunoreactivity, increased mitotic activity, and MIB-1 proliferative index greater than 3%.

mondo_label: lip and oral cavity cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Lip and Oral Cavity Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of lip and oral cavity carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.

mondo_label: lip and oral cavity cancer by ajcc v6 and v7 stage
original_label: Lip and Oral Cavity Cancer by AJCC v6 and v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of lip and oral cavity carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 6th and 7th editions.

mondo_label: major salivary gland cancer by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Major Salivary Gland Cancer by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of major salivary gland cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: major salivary gland cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Major Salivary Gland Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of major salivary gland cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.

mondo_label: pharyngeal carcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Pharyngeal Carcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of pharyngeal carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.
A malignant germ cell tumor that has spread from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

mondo_label: sinonasal cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Sinonasal Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of nasal cavity and paranasal sinus carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.

A very rare benign neoplasm that arises from the lung. It is characterized by the presence of a stromal and an epithelial component. It resembles the adenofibromas that arise from the organs of the female reproductive system.

mondo_label: laryngeal cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Laryngeal Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of laryngeal carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.

mondo_label: cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck
original_label: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck
definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the skin of the head and neck.

mondo_label: esophageal cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Esophageal Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of esophageal carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.

mondo_label: gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Gastroesophageal Junction Adenocarcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.

mondo_label: gastric cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Gastric Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of gastric cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.

mondo_label: small intestinal cancer by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Small Intestinal Cancer by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of small intestinal cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: appendix carcinoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Appendix Carcinoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of appendiceal carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition. Carcinoid tumors are staged separately. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

mondo_label: anal canal cancer by ajcc v6 and v7 stage
original_label: Anal Canal Cancer by AJCC v6 and v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of anal canal cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 6th and 7th editions. This staging system applies to carcinomas arising in the anal canal only; melanomas, carcinoid tumors, sarcomas, and perianal tumors are not included. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

mondo_label: anal cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Anal Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of anal cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to all carcinomas arising in the anal canal, including carcinomas that arise within anorectal fistulas and those arising in the perianal area (anal margin). High-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas (small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma and large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma) are staged using this system. There is no AJCC staging system for anal mucosal melanomas and anal well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: small intestinal adenocarcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Small Intestinal Adenocarcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of small intestinal adenocarcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. Nonadenocarcinomas arising in the small intestine should have a TNM assigned but are not assigned a stage classification. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: appendix carcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Appendix Carcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of appendiceal carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to carcinomas of the appendix, including high-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas, mixed adenoneuroendocrine carcinomas, and goblet cell carcinoids. Well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors (carcinoids) are staged according to the classification for neuroendocrine tumors of the appendix. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: colorectal cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Colorectal Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of colorectal cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to adenocarcinomas, high-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas, and squamous cell carcinomas of the colon and rectum. Appendiceal carcinomas, anal carcinomas, and well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors (carcinoids) are not covered by this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: hepatocellular carcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Hepatocellular Carcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of hepatocellular carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to hepatocellular carcinomas and fibrolamellar carcinomas (fibrolamellar variant of hepatocellular carcinoma). Intrahepatic cholangiocarcinomas, combined hepatocellular-cholangiocarcinomas, and sarcomas of the liver are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: intrahepatic bile duct cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of intrahepatic bile duct cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to intrahepatic cholangiocarcinomas, combined hepatocellular-cholangiocarcinomas (mixed hepatocholangiocarcinomas), and primary neuroendocrine tumors of the liver. Primary sarcomas of the liver, pure hepatocellular carcinomas, hilar cholangiocarcinomas, and gallbladder carcinomas are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: gallbladder cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Gallbladder Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of gallbladder cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to gallbladder carcinomas. Well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors and sarcomas are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: hilar cholangiocarcinoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Hilar Cholangiocarcinoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of hilar cholangiocarcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: hilar cholangiocarcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Hilar Cholangiocarcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of hilar cholangiocarcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. Hilar well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors and sarcomas are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: distal bile duct cancer by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Distal Bile Duct Cancer by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of distal bile duct cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: distal bile duct cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Distal Bile Duct Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of distal bile duct cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to bile duct adenocarcinomas, biliary intraepithelial neoplasia, high-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas, and papillary carcinomas that arise from the distal bile duct. Tumors arising in the ampulla of Vater, sarcomas, and well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors (carcinoids) are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: ampulla of vater cancer by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Ampulla of Vater Cancer by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of ampulla of Vater cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: ampulla of vater cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Ampulla of Vater Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of ampulla of Vater cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system does not apply to well-differentiated neuroendocrine (carcinoid) tumors but does apply to high-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas, such as small cell carcinoma and large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: pancreatic cancer by ajcc v6 and v7 stage
original_label: Pancreatic Cancer by AJCC v6 and v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of exocrine and endocrine pancreatic cancer including well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 6th and 7th editions.

mondo_label: pancreatic cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Pancreatic Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of exocrine pancreatic cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, acinar cell carcinoma, intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm with associated invasive carcinoma, intraductal tubulopapillary neoplasm with associated invasive carcinoma, colloid carcinoma, mucinous cystic neoplasm with associated invasive carcinoma, solid pseudopapillary neoplasm, large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma, small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma, and pancreatoblastoma. Well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
A non-small cell lung carcinoma without evidence of squamous differentiation.

mondo_label: gastric neuroendocrine tumor by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Gastric Neuroendocrine Tumor by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of a gastric neuroendocrine tumor according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to gastric "carcinoid" tumors (NET G1 and G2, and rare well-differentiated G3). Gastric high-grade neuroendocrine carcinoma and gastric mixed adenoneuroendocrine carcinoma are not included in this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: duodenal neuroendocrine tumor by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Duodenal Neuroendocrine Tumor by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of a duodenal neuroendocrine tumor according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors of the duodenum. Carcinomas of the duodenum, including high-grade (grade 3), poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinomas are not included in this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: jejunal neuroendocrine tumor by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Jejunal Neuroendocrine Tumor by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of a jejunal neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system applies to small bowel "carcinoid" tumors (NET G1 and G2, and rare well-differentiated G3) arising in the jejunum. This classification system does not apply to high-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas, mixed adenoneuroendocrine carcinomas, and neuroendocrine tumors of the duodenum. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: ileal neuroendocrine tumor by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Ileal Neuroendocrine Tumor by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of an ileal neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system applies to small bowel "carcinoid" tumors (NET G1 and G2, and rare well-differentiated G3) arising in the ileum. This classification system does not apply to high-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas, mixed adenoneuroendocrine carcinomas, and neuroendocrine tumors of the duodenum. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: digestive system neuroendocrine tumor by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Digestive System Neuroendocrine Tumor by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of a digestive system neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.

mondo_label: appendix neuroendocrine tumor by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Appendix Neuroendocrine Tumor by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of an appendiceal neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to appendiceal NETs (carcinoid tumors) (NET G1 and G2, and rare well-differentiated G3). High-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas (NEC), goblet cell carcinoids, mixed adenocarcinomas, and adenocarcinomas of the appendix are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of a pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors arising in the pancreas. Carcinomas of the pancreas, including high-grade (grade 3), poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinomas are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: thymic epithelial neoplasm by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Thymic Epithelial Neoplasm by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of a thymic epithelial neoplasm, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to thymomas, thymic carcinomas, thymic neuroendocrine tumors, and combined thymic carcinomas. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: pleural malignant mesothelioma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Pleural Malignant Mesothelioma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of pleural malignant mesothelioma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.

mondo_label: pleural malignant mesothelioma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Pleural Malignant Mesothelioma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of pleural malignant mesothelioma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to pleural diffuse malignant mesothelioma only. Localized pleural malignant mesotheliomas and other primary tumors of the pleura are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: lung cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Lung Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of lung cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system derives from analyses of the new retrospective and prospective databases of the International Association for the Study of Lung Cancer (IASLC). These databases contain information on patients diagnosed with lung cancer from 1999 to 2010 originating from 35 different databases in 16 countries around the world. This staging system applies to carcinomas of the lung, including non-small cell and small cell carcinomas, and bronchopulmonary carcinoid tumors. It does not apply to sarcomas or other rare tumors of the lung. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: bone cancer by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Bone Cancer by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of bone cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.

mondo_label: bone cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Bone Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of appendicular skeleton, trunk, skull, and facial bones cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to osteosarcoma, chondrosarcoma, Ewing sarcoma, spindle cell sarcoma, hemangioendothelioma, angiosarcoma, fibrosarcoma/myofibroid sarcoma, chordoma, adamantinoma, and other cancers arising in the bone. It does not apply to primary malignant lymphoma of the bone and multiple myeloma. There are no AJCC prognostic stage groupings for spine and pelvis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: soft tissue sarcoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Soft Tissue Sarcoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of soft tissue sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.

mondo_label: soft tissue sarcoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Soft Tissue Sarcoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of soft tissue sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.

mondo_label: uterine corpus sarcoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Uterine Corpus Sarcoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of uterine corpus sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.

An invasive adenocarcinoma that arises from the lung. It is characterized by the presence of tall columnar cells and mucin production. This category refers to cases formerly classified as mucinous bronchioloalveolar carcinoma, excluding cases that meet the criteria for adenocarcinoma in situ or mucinous minimally invasive adenocarcinoma.
A well-differentiated adenocarcinoma located in the lung periphery. It resembles colorectal adenocarcinoma with acinar and/or cribriform architecture and papillotubular structures.
A squamous cell lung carcinoma characterized by the presence of keratinization, pearl formation, and/or intercellular bridges.
A squamous cell lung carcinoma characterized by the absence of keratinization, pearl formation, and intercellular bridges.
Lung adenocarcinoma in situ characterized by the presence of type II pneumocyte and/or Clara cell differentiation. Almost all cases of lung adenocarcinoma in situ are non-mucinous.
A very rare lung adenocarcinoma in situ variant characterized by the presence of tall columnar cells with basal nuclei and abundant cytoplasmic mucin.

mondo_label: lung squamous cell carcinoma in situ
original_label: Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma In Situ
definition: A preinvasive bronchial neoplastic lesion affecting the squamous epithelium. It is characterized by the absence of progression of maturation from base to luminal surface, basilar zone expansion with cellular crowding throughout the epithelium, absence of the intermediate zone, and surface flattening confined to the most superficial cells. The nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio is often high and variable, the chromatin is coarse and uneven, and mitotic figures are present through full thickness. The cell size may be markedly increased. Anisocytosis and pleomorphism may be present. (Adapted from WHO, 2015)

mondo_label: cutaneous melanoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Cutaneous Melanoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of cutaneous melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system does not apply to melanoma of the conjunctiva, melanoma of the uvea, mucosal melanoma arising in the head and neck, and mucosal melanoma of the urethra, vagina, rectum, and anus. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
Breast carcinoma presenting with isolated axillary lymphadenopathy, without clinical or mammographic evidence of breast tumor.

mondo_label: breast pleomorphic lobular carcinoma in situ
original_label: Breast Pleomorphic Lobular Carcinoma In Situ
definition: Breast lobular carcinoma in situ characterized by the presence of neoplastic large cells with marked nuclear pleomorphism.

mondo_label: prostate carcinoma by gene expression profile
original_label: Prostate Carcinoma by Gene Expression Profile
definition: A header term that includes the following prostate carcinoma subtypes determined by gene expression profiling: luminal A prostate carcinoma, luminal B prostate carcinoma, and basal-like prostate carcinoma.

A localized low-grade follicular lymphoma within the gastrointestinal tract, which is distinct from other gastrointestinal tract follicular lymphomas.  It has features that overlap with in situ follicular neoplasia as well as some features resembling an extranodal marginal zone lymphoma of mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue. The prognosis is excellent.

mondo_label: high grade b-cell lymphoma with myc and bcl2 and/or bcl6 rearrangements
original_label: High Grade B-Cell Lymphoma with MYC and BCL2 and/or BCL6 Rearrangements
definition: High-grade B-cell lymphoma characterized by the abnormal rearrangement of MYC gene, BCL2 gene, and/or BCL6 gene. Patients with this type of lymphoma usually respond poorly to standard treatments and have a poor prognosis.

A diffuse large B-cell lymphoma characterized by double expression of MYC and BCL2 proteins without MYC and BCL2 gene aberrations. These lymphomas may have a worse prognosis than other diffuse large B-cell lymphomas, not otherwise specified, but they are not as aggressive as the high-grade B-cell lymphomas, with rearrangements of MYC and BCL2 and/or BCL6 genes.

A group of node-based peripheral T-cell lymphomas with phenotypic features of T follicular helper (TFH) cells. This category includes the following: follicular helper T-cell lymphoma, angioimmunoblastic-type; follicular helper T-cell lymphoma, follicular-type; and follicular helper T-cell lymphoma, not otherwise specified.

mondo_label: multiple myeloma myeloma by ds stage
original_label: Multiple Myeloma Myeloma by DS Stage
definition: A header term that refers to the staging of multiple myeloma according to the Durie/Salmon staging system.
A header term that refers to the staging of multiple myeloma according to the International Staging System.
A variant of lymphomatoid papulosis which mimics primary cutaneous aggressive epidermotropic CD8-positive cytotoxic T-cell lymphoma.
A variant of lymphomatoid papulosis characterized by the presence of atypical lymphocytes which exhibited distinct angioinvasion.

mondo_label: lymphomatoid papulosis with dusp22-irf4 gene rearrangement
original_label: Lymphomatoid Papulosis with DUSP22-IRF4 Gene Rearrangement
definition: A variant of lymphomatoid papulosis associated with chromosomal rearrangements involving the DUSP22-IRF4 locus at 6p25.3.

mondo_label: breast cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Breast Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. It applies to invasive (infiltrating) carcinoma of the breast and ductal carcinoma in situ of the breast. It does not apply to breast sarcoma, phyllodes tumor, and breast lymphoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
A benign epithelial-stromal neoplasm that arises from the perineum and resembles the breast fibroadenoma.

mondo_label: vulvar composite hidradenoma papilliferum and fibroadenoma
original_label: Vulvar Composite Hidradenoma Papilliferum and Fibroadenoma
definition: A benign composite neoplasm that arises from the vulva and is characterized by mixed histopathologic features of hidradenoma papilliferum and fibroadenoma.

mondo_label: vulvar cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Vulvar Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of vulvar cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to all carcinomas of the vulva. Melanoma of the vulva is staged according to the classification for melanoma of the skin. (AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: vaginal cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Vaginal Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of vaginal cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to all carcinomas of the vagina. There is no AJCC staging system for mucosal melanoma of the vagina. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: cervical cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Cervical Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of cervical cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.

mondo_label: uterine corpus cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Uterine Corpus Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of uterine corpus cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to carcinomas and carcinosarcomas. It does not apply to uterine corpus sarcomas: leiomyosarcomas, endometrial stromal sarcomas, and adenosarcomas. These sarcomas are staged according to the classification for uterine corpus sarcomas. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: uterine corpus sarcoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Uterine Corpus Sarcoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of uterine corpus sarcoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to leiomyosarcomas, endometrial stromal sarcomas, and adenosarcomas of the uterine corpus. It does not apply to carcinosarcomas which are staged according to the carcinomas and carcinosarcomas of the uterine corpus. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: ovarian cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Ovarian Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of ovarian cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to ovarian carcinomas. Nonepithelial primary ovarian cancers may be staged using this classification but should be reported separately. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: fallopian tube cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Fallopian Tube Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of fallopian tube cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.

mondo_label: primary peritoneal cancer by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Primary Peritoneal Cancer by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of primary peritoneal cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: primary peritoneal cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Primary Peritoneal Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of primary peritoneal cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition.

mondo_label: gestational trophoblastic tumor by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of gestational trophoblastic tumor according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: penile cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Penile Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of penile cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to penile squamous cell carcinoma and associated histologic subtypes. It does not apply to urethral carcinomas, sarcomas, and melanomas. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: prostate cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Prostate Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of prostate cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to adenocarcinomas and squamous cell carcinomas of the prostate gland. It does not apply to sarcomas, urothelial cell carcinomas, and urothelial carcinoma of bladder involving prostate. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: testicular cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Testicular Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of testicular cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to postpubertal germ cell tumors of the testis and malignant sex cord-stromal tumors of the testis. It does not apply to spermatocytic tumors (no AJCC staging system), nonmalignant sex cord-/gonadal -stromal tumors (no AJCC staging system), prepubertal germ cell tumors (no AJCC staging system), hematolymphoid tumors (hematologic malignancies staging system), and paratesticular neoplasms (no AJCC staging system).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: testicular cancer by ajcc v6 and v7 stage
original_label: Testicular Cancer by AJCC v6 and v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of testicular cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 6th and 7th editions.

mondo_label: renal cell cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Renal Cell Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of kidney cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to carcinomas arising in the kidney. It does not apply to urothelial carcinomas (are staged according to the classification for renal pelvis and ureter), lymphomas (are staged according to the classification for Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphoma), sarcomas (are staged according to the classification for soft tissue sarcoma of the abdomen and thoracic visceral organs), and Wilms tumor (no AJCC staging system). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: renal pelvis and ureter cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Renal Pelvis and Ureter Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of renal pelvis and ureter cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to renal pelvis and ureter urothelial (transitional cell) carcinoma, including histologic variants micropapillary and nested subtypes. It does not apply to renal cell carcinomas (are staged according to the classification for kidney), renal medullary carcinomas (are staged according to the classification for kidney), collecting duct carcinomas (are staged according to the classification for kidney),  lymphomas (are staged according to the classification for Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphoma), and mesenchymal tumors (are staged according to the classification for soft tissue sarcoma of the abdomen and thoracic visceral organs). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: renal pelvis and ureter cancer by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Renal Pelvis and Ureter Cancer by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of renal pelvis and ureter cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: bladder cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Bladder Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of bladder cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to carcinomas arising in the bladder. The typical carcinoma of the bladder is urothelial carcinoma. These carcinomas may include other histologic elements, including adenocarcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, and small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma, but should be classified as urothelial unless the cancer is composed entirely of the alternative histology. All histologic cell types that are derived primarily from the urinary bladder epithelium should follow this staging system. It does not apply to prostatic urothelial carcinomas (are staged according to the classification for urethra), lymphomas (are staged according to the classification for Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphoma), and sarcomas (are staged according to the classification for soft tissue sarcoma of the abdomen and thoracic visceral organs).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: urethral cancer by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Urethral Cancer by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of urethral cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to urothelial (transitional cell), squamous, and glandular carcinomas of the urethra and to urothelial (transitional cell) carcinomas of the prostate and prostatic urethra. It does not apply to squamous cell carcinomas of the penile foreskin (are staged according to the classification for penis), primary urothelial carcinomas of the bladder with transmural involvement of the prostate (are staged according to the classification for urinary bladder), prostatic adenocarcinomas (are staged according to the classification for prostate), mucosal melanomas of the urethra (no AJCC staging system), lymphomas (are staged according to the classification for Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphoma), and sarcomas (are staged according to the classification for soft tissue sarcoma of the abdomen and thoracic visceral organs).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: urethral cancer by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Urethral Cancer by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of urethral cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: eyelid carcinoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Eyelid Carcinoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of eyelid carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition.

mondo_label: eyelid carcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Eyelid Carcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of eyelid carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system applies to all primary carcinomas of the eyelid, including basal cell carcinoma (BCC), squamous cell carcinoma (SCC), sebaceous carcinoma, and other rare carcinomas, such as all varieties of sweat gland carcinoma (e.g., eccrine carcinoma). It does not apply to carcinomas of the head and neck with direct extension to eyelid (are staged according to the cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas of the head and neck), Merkel cell carcinomas of the eyelid (are staged according to the classification for Merkel cell carcinomas), and melanomas of the eyelid (are staged according to the classification for melanomas of the skin).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: choroidal and ciliary body melanoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Choroidal and Ciliary Body Melanoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of choroidal and ciliary body melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.

mondo_label: uveal melanoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Uveal Melanoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of uveal melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.

A term that refers to the staging of retinoblastoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition. This staging system does not apply to central nervous system component of "trilateral retinoblastoma" (is staged according to the classification for brain and spinal cord), retinoma (or retinocytoma) (no AJCC staging system), and medulloepithelioma (no AJCC staging system). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: differentiated thyroid gland carcinoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of differentiated thyroid gland carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.

mondo_label: differentiated thyroid gland carcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of differentiated thyroid gland carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.

mondo_label: thyroid gland anaplastic carcinoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Thyroid Gland Anaplastic Carcinoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of thyroid gland anaplastic carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.

mondo_label: thyroid gland anaplastic carcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Thyroid Gland Anaplastic Carcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of thyroid gland anaplastic carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.

mondo_label: thyroid gland medullary carcinoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Thyroid Gland Medullary Carcinoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of thyroid gland medullary carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.

mondo_label: thyroid gland medullary carcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Thyroid Gland Medullary Carcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of thyroid gland medullary carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. Differentiated and anaplastic thyroid gland carcinomas are staged according to the classification for thyroid-differentiated and anaplastic carcinoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: adrenal cortical carcinoma by ajcc v7 stage
original_label: Adrenal Cortical Carcinoma by AJCC v7 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of adrenal cortical carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.

mondo_label: adrenal cortical carcinoma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Adrenal Cortical Carcinoma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of adrenal cortical carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. Adrenal medullary pheochromocytoma is staged according to the classification for adrenal neuroendocrine tumors. There is no AJCC staging system for neuroblastic tumors of the adrenal gland. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: adrenal gland pheochromocytoma and sympathetic paraganglioma by ajcc v8 stage
original_label: Adrenal Gland Pheochromocytoma and Sympathetic Paraganglioma by AJCC v8 Stage
definition: A term that refers to the staging of adrenal gland pheochromocytoma and sympathetic paraganglioma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. Parasympathetic paragangliomas are not staged because they are largely benign. This staging system does not apply to neuroendocrine tumors of the pancreas (are staged according to the classification for neuroendocrine tumors of the pancreas) and carotid body tumors (not staged). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

mondo_label: chronic lymphocytic leukemia- modified rai staging system
original_label: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia- Modified Rai Staging System
definition: A term that refers to the staging of chronic lymphocytic leukemia according to modified Rai staging system. This system is mainly used in North America.

mondo_label: chronic lymphocytic leukemia- binet staging system
original_label: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia- Binet Staging System
definition: A term that refers to the staging of chronic lymphocytic leukemia according to Binet staging system. This system is in wide use outside the United States.

A staging system for multiple myeloma based on the Revised International Staging System (RISS) criteria. This staging system does not apply to smoldering multiple myeloma (no AJCC staging system), monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance (no AJCC staging system), and Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia (no AJCC staging system). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

A highly aggressive, poorly differentiated carcinoma that arises from the thoracic structures. It is characterized by mutations and rearrangement of the NUT gene. It usually presents at an advanced stage with pleuritic chest pain and pleural effusion, non-productive cough, shortness of breath, and weigh loss.
A benign lung tumor that arises from perivascular epithelioid cells (PECs).
A sarcoma arising from the arterial intima of pulmonary arteries.

mondo_label: primary pulmonary myxoid sarcoma with ewsr1-creb1 fusion
original_label: Primary Pulmonary Myxoid Sarcoma with EWSR1-CREB1 Fusion
definition: A sarcoma that arises from the lung. It is related to a bronchus and is often predominantly endobronchial. It is characterized by the proliferation of round and spindle cells within a myxoid stroma. It is associated with the presence of an EWSR1::CREB1 fusion gene.
Rhabdoid tumor that does not respond to treatment.
A rare type A thymoma displaying atypical features (hypercellularity, increased mitotic activity, and focal necrosis).
A very rare adenocarcinoma arising from the thymus. It is characterized by the presence of malignant polygonal cells resembling hepatocytes.

mondo_label: malignant mediastinal germ cell tumor stage grouping of the pediatric study group
original_label: Malignant Mediastinal Germ Cell Tumor Stage Grouping of the Pediatric Study Group
definition: A term that refers to the staging of mediastinal malignant germ cell tumors according to the Pediatric Study Group staging criteria. This staging system is not an official UICC TNM classification. (WHO Classification of Tumors of the Lung, Pleura, Thymus and Heart, 2015)
An epithelioid hemangioendothelioma that has spread from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the mediastinum. It is characterized by the presence of at least two different germ cell tumor components. The different germ cell tumor components include choriocarcinoma, embryonal carcinoma, yolk sac tumor, teratoma, and seminoma.
An epithelioid hemangioendothelioma that arises from the mediastinum.
An extraskeletal osteosarcoma that arises from the heart. It produces osteoid and bone, and occasionally shows chondroblastic differentiation.
A low-grade sarcoma that arises from the heart. It is composed of spindle or rounded cells in a myxoid stroma. The most common location is the left atrium.
A yolk sac tumor that arises within the myocardium or cardiac chambers.
A rare sarcoma that arises from the pericardium. The two most common types are angiosarcoma and synovial sarcoma. Patients present with symptoms related to pericardial effusion.
The reemergence of a lymphoproliferative disorder after a period of remission.
An oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma which is negative for p16INK4a by immunohistochemistry. This negative immunohistochemistry result does not exclude human papillomavirus infection.

mondo_label: central nervous system b-cell non-hodgkin lymphoma
original_label: Central Nervous System B-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
definition: A B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma that arises from the brain, meninges, or spinal cord.
Melanoma that does not respond to treatment.
Round cell liposarcoma that does not respond to treatment.
Round cell liposarcoma that has spread to other anatomic sites.
A sarcoma that does not respond to treatment.
Leukemia that is resistant to treatment.
Advanced prostatic carcinoma which was not previously treated with androgen-deprivation therapy.
An adenocarcinoma that arises from the thoracic esophagus.
A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the thoracic esophagus.
An adenocarcinoma that arises from the cervical esophagus.
A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the cervical esophagus.
A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the gastric cardia.
Neuroblastoma usually presenting with metastatic disease and MYCN gene amplifications.

A lymphoproliferative disorder caused by the human herpesvirus 8 (HHV8). This category includes the following: HHV8-positive multicentric Castleman disease; HHV8-positive diffuse large B-cell lymphoma, not otherwise specified; primary effusion lymphoma; and germinotropic lymphoproliferative disorders.
Multicentric Castleman disease associated with HHV8 infection.
A rare HHV8-positive B-cell lymphoma indistinguishable from primary effusion lymphoma presenting as solid tumor mass. (WHO 2017)

A large B-cell lymphoma presenting as a serous effusion without detectable tumor masses. It is universally associated with human herpes virus 8 (HHV8), also called Kaposi sarcoma-associated herpesvirus.  It mostly occurs in the setting of immunodeficiency. The most common sites of involvement are the pleural, pericardial, and peritoneal cavities. (WHO 2017)
Malignant bone neoplasm that is resistant to treatment.

mondo_label: refractory malignant female reproductive system neoplasm
original_label: Refractory Malignant Female Reproductive System Neoplasm
definition: Malignant female reproductive system neoplasm that is resistant to treatment.

mondo_label: refractory malignant neoplasm of multiple primary sites
original_label: Refractory Malignant Neoplasm of Multiple Primary Sites
definition: Malignant neoplasm of multiple primary sites that is resistant to treatment.

mondo_label: refractory malignant male reproductive system neoplasm
original_label: Refractory Malignant Male Reproductive System Neoplasm
definition: Malignant male reproductive system neoplasm that is resistant to treatment.
Malignant mesothelioma that is resistant to treatment.
Malignant soft tissue neoplasm that is resistant to treatment.
Malignant endocrine neoplasm that is resistant to treatment.
Malignant urinary system neoplasm that is resistant to treatment.
Malignant skin neoplasm that is resistant to treatment.
A prostate adenocarcinoma characterized by the absence of focal or diffuse neuroendocrine differentiation.

mondo_label: igm monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance
original_label: IgM Monoclonal Gammopathy of Undetermined Significance
definition: Monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance defined by a serum IgM paraprotein concentration less than 30g/L; bone marrow lymphoplasmacytic infiltration of less than 10%; and no evidence of anemia, constitutional symptoms, hyperviscocity, lymphadenopathy, hepatosplenomegaly, or other end-organ damage that can be attributed to the underlying lymphoproliferative disorder. It is a precursor condition that may progress to lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma/ Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia, other B-cell neoplasms, or primary amyloidosis. Progression to plasma cell myeloma occurs rarely, if at all. (WHO 2017)
A carcinoma that arises from the bladder mucosa and invades the bladder wall.
A cerebral neoplasm that is confined to a specific site without evidence of spread to other anatomic sites.

mondo_label: non-igm monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance
original_label: Non-IgM Monoclonal Gammopathy of Undetermined Significance
definition: Monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance defined by the presence in the serum of an IgG, IgA, or (rarely) IgD paraprotein at a concentration of less than 30g/L; clonal bone marrow plasma cells less than 10%; and absence of end-organ damage such as hypercalcemia, renal insufficiency, anemia, bone marrow lesions, and amyloidosis attributable to the plasma cell proliferative disorder. The risk of progression to plasma cell myeloma, light-chain amyloidosis, or a related disorder is 1% per year. (WHO 2017)

A distinctive variant of follicular lymphoma arising from the testis. It has been reported with higher frequency in children, but is also seen rarely in adults. It differs biologically from nodal follicular lymphoma because it lacks evidence of the BCL2 translocation. It is usually of high cytological grade, usually grade 3A, but has a good prognosis, even without additional therapy beyond surgical excision. (WHO 2017)

mondo_label: metastatic malignant neoplasm in the viscera
original_label: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Viscera
definition: A malignant neoplasm which has spread from its original site of growth to any visceral site.
Malignant neoplasm that is amenable to surgical resection.
A lymphoproliferative disorder that occurs in a patient with immunodeficiency.
This category includes two main sub-groups, according to the degree of cytological atypia and clinical aggressiveness: Langerhans cell histiocytosis and Langerhans cell sarcoma. (WHO 2017)
Langerhans cell histiocytosis presenting as a solitary lesion.
Langerhans cell histiocytosis presenting with multiple sites of involvement.
Langerhans cell histiocytosis presenting with disseminated disease.
Histologic transformation of a usually indolent non-Hodgkin lymphoma to an aggressive non-Hodgkin lymphoma.

mondo_label: acute leukemia of ambiguous lineage, not otherwise specified
original_label: Acute Leukemia of Ambiguous Lineage, Not Otherwise Specified
definition: Acute leukemia of ambiguous lineage, expressing combinations of markers that do not allow for its classification as either acute undifferentiated leukemia or mixed phenotype acute leukemia, and definitive classification along a single lineage is difficult. (WHO 2017)
Rhabdomyosarcoma involving the organs and structures in the abdomen.
Undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma involving the organs and structures in the abdomen.

mondo_label: mixed phenotype acute leukemia, rare types
original_label: Mixed Phenotype Acute Leukemia, Rare Types
definition: A very rare mixed phenotype acute leukemia in which the blasts express combinations of B, T, myeloid, and megakaryocytic lineage markers but are negative for KMT2A rearrangement and t(9;22)(q34;q11.2) translocation. The prognosis is usually unfavorable.
A sarcoma that has spread from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

mondo_label: refractory malignant head and neck neoplasm
original_label: Refractory Malignant Head and Neck Neoplasm
definition: A malignant head and neck neoplasm that is resistant to treatment.

mondo_label: refractory ewing sarcoma/peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor
original_label: Refractory Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
definition: A malignant small round cell tumor with or without neural differentiation that is resistant to treatment.
A chordoma that has spread from its original site of growth to other anatomic sites.
Metastatic prostatic carcinoma which is sensitive to androgen-deprivation therapy.
A poorly differentiated carcinoma that arises from the nasal cavity and/or paranasal sinuses.

mondo_label: densely granulated corticotroph pituitary neuroendocrine tumor
original_label: Densely Granulated Corticotroph Pituitary Neuroendocrine Tumor
definition: A corticotroph pituitary neuroendocrine tumor composed of basophilic PAS-positive cells that are diffusely and strongly positive for ACTH, consistent with the abundance of secretory granules seen at the ultrastructural level. (WHO)

mondo_label: sparsely granulated corticotroph pituitary neuroendocrine tumor
original_label: Sparsely Granulated Corticotroph Pituitary Neuroendocrine Tumor
definition: A corticotroph pituitary neuroendocrine tumor composed of faintly basophilic or chromophobic PAS-positive cells with weak or patchy positivity for ACTH, consistent with the scant, small secretory granules seen ultrastructurally. (WHO)

A corticotroph pituitary tumor composed of cells with Crooke hyaline change. Ring-like cytokeratin expression is typical of these neoplasms. ACTH expression is dislocated to the cell periphery and juxtanuclear region. Ultrastructurally, intermediate filaments are arranged in a ring-like pattern. (WHO)
Corticotroph pituitary neuroendocrine tumor not associated with a hormonal syndrome.

A rare tumor, usually occurring in young adults (mean age 12 years) with slight female predominance. It is characterized by a proliferation of anaplastic spindle cells with bizarre, pleomorphic nuclei and atypical mitotic figures. Most cases show chondroid differentiation.
